intro: Triclinium marilandica, commonly known as Maryland morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Triclinium marilandica thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
